channel.title: Need some serious help
channel.description:
Ok, well I used to code and make my own servers, it was kinda a hobby of mine. I haven't done it in about 2 years now and as you all know things have changed drastically. I still know how to code the servers, but what I cant figure out is how to actually get on the server and get into the server.java, and client.java to edit and change stuff (maybe this changed and we do it a different way?). So my question is simply, how do we find the client.java and server.java in order to edit and change and code the server? Whenever I download a client in the download section i just get a bunch of folders and .class files (which i've never worked with before so I don't know what they are).
So anyone that could help me find the server.java and client.java and how to actually get onto the server myself so I can edit it, I'd really appreciate.
Thanks :)

item.title: Need some serious help
item.dc:creator: @West7man West7man
item.description:
@West7man wrote:

There is a search box in windows explorer…
I guess you are editing servers using a batch file to compile and notepad to edit?
Download Eclipse… It’s easy to learn to use.
Create a new project using existing source.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some serious help
item.dc:creator: @The_Chubby_Bunny The Chubby Bunny
item.description:
@The_Chubby_Bunny wrote:

you are referring to wL (winterLove) server, search one on google.

Read full topic

item.title: Need some serious help
item.dc:creator: @davis_p davis p
item.description:
@davis_p wrote:

All them folders are what you need to edit… Such as client.java and the other stuff. And under the config file is npc.cfg and autospawns and more…

Read full topic
